Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; top of rim glazed; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of head of sphinx (hair, eyebrow, corner of eye, ear and curlicue remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the third stage of the Group of the Simple Figures. The vases in this group were probably all produced by the same hand. The leading vase from this group is the Tarentum chalice (Lemos 1991, no. 938). Flat-headed passant sphinxes with long hair falling in three separate tresses are a recurrent theme.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 131, p. 288, no. 860, pl. 119)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1027) (phase 2)
